channel.title: [317] Cyberus
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i524.photobucket.com/albums/cc330/Rabrg/Cyberus.jpg[/img] [i] [size=18pt]Idea:[/size][/i] [b]Cyberus[/b] is a [b]Hyperion[/b] based server. Its a [b]317[/b] loading the [b]377[/b] cache, I do not plan to load things that weren't originally in the cache like Dragon fire shield, Bandos godsword, Dark bow, Vesta long sword, etc. Just because it we won't be loading any newer data does [b]NOT[/b] mean its going to be a OSRemake. I [b]AM[/b] going to finish, and host this. After I am done I may release this. I believe if I did that it would encourage people to use a much better base than winterLove. It would also encourage people to learn two other languages, [b]XML[/b] and [b]JScript[/b]. [i] [size=18pt]Team:[/size][/i] [b]Ryan[/b] (Aeronity) [i] [size=18pt]Goal:[/size][/i] To make a fun, stable server that players won't get bored on. [i] [size=18pt]Languages:[/size][/i] [b]JScript[/b]; our scripting language. [b]XML[/b]; our database language. And [b]Java[/b], of course. [i] [size=18pt]Media:[/size][/i] [b]Server[/b]
[IMG]http://i524.photobucket.com/albums/cc330/Rabrg/Privatechat.jpg[/img]
[b]Client[/b]
[i] [size=18pt]Report system:[/size][/i] I have a feeling that I will be asked what this does, so here is how it works: The reporter types in the players name on the report screen and then clicks the rule they broke. If the player that they reported is not online it will stop there and send the message "You can't report a player that isn't online!" If the player is online it will flag that player. What flagging does is, when the player is first flagged, it will create a text file named after the reported player. At the beginning of the file it will show the time and date of when the player was reported, who reported the player, and the reason the player was reported. When the player is flagged it will also record actions that the player does in the text file until the player logs out, then the player will be unflagged. The moderator option on the report screen DOES work. [i] [size=18pt]Update log:[/size][/i]
12/8: (Not all the updates for this date was made today, this is just when the project has officially started) Started the project officially. Added dialogue system. Loading NPC spawns via XML. Added report abuse system. Added ground item support. Made a RuneWiki dumping tool for data. Added NPC clicking packet. Added item clicking packet. Added client focus packet. 12/10 Added muting system. Added banning system. Added black marks system. Added RSA. 12/11: Added private messaging. Added setting saving. (Auto retaliate, split chat, chat effects, etc) Started a weight system with a very accurate energy restoring system based on weight. Redoing private messaging because I fucked up on it.
[/center] I am looking for at least one more programmer. If you are interested read this thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,467922.0.html

item.title: [317] Cyberus
item.dc:creator: @Aeronity Aeronity
item.description:
@Aeronity wrote:

Uncalled:

I really am not a huge fan of this right now; but good luck.

May I ask why?

Edit: Encrypting user names, passwords, and the used Id while its being sent to the server. (RSA) (It also disables people from using other clients.

item.title: [317] Cyberus
item.dc:creator: @Aeronity Aeronity
item.description:
@Aeronity wrote:

[center]

[size=18pt]Idea:[/size]
Cyberus is a Hyperion based server. Its a 317 loading the 377 cache, I do not plan to load things that weren’t originally in the cache like Dragon fire shield, Bandos godsword, Dark bow, Vesta long sword, etc. Just because it we won’t be loading any newer data does NOT mean its going to be a OSRemake.

I AM going to finish, and host this. After I am done I may release this. I believe if I did that it would encourage people to use a much better base than winterLove. It would also encourage people to learn two other languages, XML and JScript.


[size=18pt]Team:[/size]
Ryan (Aeronity)
[i]

[size=18pt]Goal:[/size][/i]
To make a fun, stable server that players won’t get bored on.


[size=18pt]Languages:[/size]
JScript; our scripting language.
XML; our database language.
And Java, of course.


[size=18pt]Media:[/size]

Server

[IMG]http://i524.photobucket.com/albums/cc330/Rabrg/Privatechat.jpg[/img]
[b]Client[/b]


[size=18pt]Report system:[/size]

I have a feeling that I will be asked what this does, so here is how it works:

The reporter types in the players name on the report screen and then clicks the rule they broke.

If the player that they reported is not online it will stop there and send the message “You can’t report a player that isn’t online!”

If the player is online it will flag that player. What flagging does is, when the player is first flagged, it will create a text file named after the reported player. At the beginning of the file it will show the time and date of when the player was reported, who reported the player, and the reason the player was reported. When the player is flagged it will also record actions that the player does in the text file until the player logs out, then the player will be unflagged.

The moderator option on the report screen DOES work.


[size=18pt]Update log:[/size]

12/8: (Not all the updates for this date was made today, this is just when the project has officially started) Started the project officially. Added dialogue system. Loading NPC spawns via XML. Added report abuse system. Added ground item support. Made a RuneWiki dumping tool for data. Added NPC clicking packet. Added item clicking packet. Added client focus packet. 12/10 Added muting system. Added banning system. Added black marks system. Added RSA. 12/11: Added private messaging. Added setting saving. (Auto retaliate, split chat, chat effects, etc) Started a weight system with a very accurate energy restoring system based on weight. Redoing private messaging because I fucked up on it.
[/center]

I am looking for at least one more programmer. If you are interested read this thread:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
